intro: Tribulus acanthococcus, commonly known as the spiny goat's rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Zygophyllaceae. It is characterized by its branched stems, small yellow flowers, and distinctive spiny leaves. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces small, red or orange fruits that contain seeds. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand high temperatures.
